Effective Date.selected_text: certificate with an effective date of January 1, 2021.
Effective Date.content: The Issue Date of the Policy is January 1, 2021. This certificate supersedes and replaces any previously issued certificate with an effective date of January 1, 2021. Certificate of Insurance for Class 2 You are entitled to the benefits described in this Certificate only if you are eligible, become and remain insured under the provisions of the Policy. This Certificate replaces any other certificates for the benefits described inside. As a Certificate of Insurance, it is not a contract of insurance; it only summarizes the provisions of the Policy and is subject to the Policy's terms. If the provisions of this Certificate and the Policy do not agree, the provisions of the Policy will apply.

qa_pairs.question: What is the effective date for an employee's initial coverage amount?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page [5], an Employee's initial amount of coverage becomes effective at 12:01 a.m. on the latest of four conditions: 1) the first day of the Insurance Month coinciding with or next following the date the Employee becomes eligible for the coverage; 2) the date the Employee resumes Active Work, if not Actively at Work on the day he or she becomes eligible; 3) the date the Employee makes written application for coverage and signs a payroll deduction order or an order to pay premiums from the Employee's Flexible Spending Account (FSA); or 4) the date the Employee is insured under the Policy.

qa_pairs.question: When will an Insured Employee become insured for the Progressive Income Benefit?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page [27], an Insured Employee will become insured for the Progressive Income Benefit on one of two conditions: 1) the effective date of his or her coverage for Long Term Disability Benefits under the Policy; or 2) the effective date of this provision, if it is added later by amending the Policy.

qa_pairs.question: What is considered as "Pre-Existing Condition" in this policy?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page [27], a "Pre-Existing Condition" means a Sickness or Injury for which the Insured Employee received treatment within 3 months prior to his or her Effective Date under this benefit. Treatment includes a Physician's consultation, care and services; diagnostic measures; and the prescription, refill or taking of prescribed drugs or medicines.

qa_pairs.question: What is the waiting period for an employee to become eligible for coverage under the policy in this insurance document?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page [3, 9, 14, 15], the waiting period means the period of time an Employee must be employed in an eligible class with the Employer, before he or she becomes eligible to enroll for coverage under the Policy. The period of service must be continuous, except as explained in the Eligibility provision captioned Prior Service Credit Toward Waiting Period.

qa_pairs.question: How can prior service be applied toward the waiting period in this insurance document?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page [14, 15], Prior Service Credit Toward Waiting Period can be applied when a former Employee is rehired within one year after his or her employment ends, or if the coverage is reinstated without satisfying a new Waiting Period or providing Evidence of Insurability.

Contribution.selected_text: before taxes and any deductions for pre-tax contributions to a Section 125 Plan, flexible spending account,
Contribution.content: It is figured from the income box on the Insured Employee's W-2 form, which reports wages, tips and other compensation from the Employer for federal income tax purposes. It includes the Insured Employee's income before taxes and any deductions for pre-tax contributions to a Section 125 Plan, flexible spending account, Section 401K Plan or qualified deferred compensation plan. It does  not  include: 1. any Employer contributions to a deferred compensation plan; 2. income received from any car, housing or moving allowance; or 3. income from a source other than the Employer. It will not exceed the amount shown in the Employer's financial records, the amount for which premium has been paid, or the Maximum Covered Monthly Earnings permitted by the Policy; whichever is less. (Maximum Covered Monthly Earnings equals the Maximum Monthly Benefit divided by the Benefit Percentage shown in the Schedule of Benefits.) Exception: For purposes of determining the Partial Disability Monthly Benefit, Basic Monthly Earnings will not exceed the amount shown in the Employer's financial records. For an Insured Employee who did not receive a W-2 form from the Employer prior to the Determination Date, it is figured by averaging the monthly gross earnings received during the actual period of employment, as shown in the Employer's financial records.

Functions performed by the Plan Administrator include: the receipt and deposit of contributions, maintenance of records of Plan participants, authorization and payment of Plan administrative expenses, selection of the insurance consultant, selection of the insurance carrier and assisting The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company. The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company has the sole discretionary authority to determine eligibility and to administer claims in accord with its interpretation of policy provisions, on the Plan Administrator's behalf (this does not apply to employers sitused in California or to California residents). Type of Administration. The Plan is administered directly by the Plan Administrator with benefits provided in accordance with provisions of the group insurance policy issued by The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company whose Group Insurance Service Office address is 8801 Indian Hills Drive, Omaha, Nebraska. Type of Plan. The benefits provided under the Plan are: Group Long Term Disability Insurance benefits. Type of Funding Arrangement: The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company. All employees are given a Certificate of Group Insurance which contains a detailed description of the Benefits, Pre- Existing Condition Limitation, Exclusions and Prior Carrier Credit provisions. The Certificate also contains the Schedule of Benefits which includes information on the Benefit Percentage, Maximum and Minimum Monthly Benefits, Elimination Period, Maximum Benefit Period, Own Occupation Period and Waiting Period. If your Booklet, Certificate or Schedule of Benefits has been misplaced, you may obtain a copy from the Plan Administrator at no charge. Eligibility. Full-time employees working at least 30 hours per week. Employees become eligible on the first of the month coinciding with or next following active full-time employment. Contributions. Insured employees are not required to contribute to the cost of the Long-Term Disability coverage. The Plan's year ends on: December 31 st  of each year. The name and section of relevant Collective Bargaining Agreements: None The name, title and address of each Plan Trustee: None

qa_pairs.question: What is the source of the income used for Long-Term Disability coverage cost determination?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page 3, the income used for Long-Term Disability coverage cost determination is an employee's regular wages or salary.

qa_pairs.question: What percentage of the Long-Term Disability coverage cost does the insured employee contribute?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page 40, insured employees are not required to contribute to the cost of the Long-Term Disability coverage.

qa_pairs.question: What is the duration of the Plan's year?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page 40, the Plan's year ends on December 31st of each year.

qa_pairs.question: What is the Maximum Monthly Benefit for an Insured Employee under this policy?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page 3, the Maximum Monthly Benefit will not exceed the Benefit Percentage times Basic Monthly Earnings. The Benefit Percentage is 60%.

qa_pairs.question: How many calendar days should an Insured Employee accumulate during a 180-day period to become eligible for benefits?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page 3, the Elimination Period is 90 calendar days of Disability caused by the same or a related Sickness or Injury, which must be accumulated within a 180 calendar day period.

qa_pairs.question: What is the maximum duration for benefits due to Sickness, Injury or Pre-Existing Conditions?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page 40, the Maximum Benefit Period for an Insured Employee with a Disability caused by Sickness, Injury or Pre-Existing Conditions is dependent on their age at disability. For instance, if the Insured Employee's Social Security Normal Retirement Age is less than 60, the Maximum Benefit Period is 60 months; if it is 65, the Maximum Benefit Period is 24 months.

Benefit Percentage.content: It will not exceed the amount shown in the Employer's financial records, the amount for which premium has been paid, or the Maximum Covered Monthly Earnings permitted by the Policy; whichever is less. For an Insured Employee who did not receive a W-2 form from the Employer prior to the Determination Date, it is figured by averaging the monthly gross earnings received during the actual period of employment, as shown in the Employer's financial records.

qa_pairs.question: What is the definition of a Pre-Existing Condition according to Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf?
qa_pairs.answer: A Pre-Existing Condition, as defined on page 3 of Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf, is a Sickness or Injury for which the Insured Employee received treatment within 3 months prior to the Insured Employee's Effective Date. Treatment includes consultation, care or services provided by a Physician, diagnostic measures, and the prescription, refill of prescription, or taking of any prescribed drugs or medicines.

qa_pairs.question: How long does the Pre-Existing Condition Exclusion period last?
qa_pairs.answer: The Pre-Existing Condition Exclusion period is for the first 12 months after the Insured Employee's Effective Date, as stated on page 15 of Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf.

qa_pairs.question: Can benefits be paid for a Total Disability due to a Pre-Existing Condition? If yes, under what conditions?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, benefits may be payable for a Total Disability due to a Pre-Existing Condition if the Employee was insured by the prior carrier's policy at the time of transfer and was Actively-At-Work and insured under the Policy on the Policy's Effective Date. This is detailed on page 26 and 27 of Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf. If the Insured Employee qualifies for benefits, the Company will apply the Policy's Pre-Existing Condition Exclusion, but can satisfy the prior carrier's condition giving consideration towards continuous time insured under both policies; then he/she will be paid according to the Policy's benefit schedule mentioned on page 32 of Lincoln Cert 5439095 conditions and requirements of the Policy. This is stated on page 32 Existing Condition Exclusion, as detailed on page 3 carrier's policy, whichever results in a greater benefit amount. This scenario is not covered by any prior carrier's policy at time transfer or cannot satisfy both policies's continuity insured under either policy and the Employee will be paid according to Policy's benefit schedule if the Employee qualifies for benefits under the prior carrier's satisfy the prior carrier's pre-existing condition giving consideration towards continuous time insured under both policies; then he or she will be paid in accord with the benefit schedule and all other terms, conditions and limitations of: (a) the Policy without applying the Pre-Existing Condition Exclusion; or (b) the prior carrier's policy; whichever results in a greater benefit amount. If the Insured Employee cannot satisfy the Pre-Existing Condition Exclusion of the Policy or that of the prior carrier, no benefit will be paid. The Company will apply the Policy's Pre-Existing Condition Exclusion, but can satisfy the prior carrier's pre-existing condition exclusion giving consideration towards continuous time insured under both policies; then he or she will be paid according to the Policy's schedule if qualifies for benefits under the prior carrier's conditions and limitations of: (a) the Policy without applying the Pre-Existing Condition Exclusion; or (b) the prior carrier's policy; whichever results in a greater benefit amount. If cannot satisfy Pre-Existing Condition Exclusion of the Policy or the prior carrier, no benefit will be paid. The Company will apply.

qa_pairs.question: What is the definition of a Pre-Existing Condition according to Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf?
qa_pairs.answer: A Pre-Existing Condition, as defined on page 3 of Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf, is a Sickness or Injury for which the Insured Employee received treatment within 3 months prior to the Insured Employee's Effective Date. Treatment includes consultation, care or services provided by a Physician, diagnostic measures, and the prescription, refill of prescription, or taking of any prescribed drugs or medicines.

qa_pairs.question: How long does the Pre-Existing Condition Exclusion period last?
qa_pairs.answer: The Pre-Existing Condition Exclusion period is for the first 12 months after the Insured Employee's Effective Date, as stated on page 15 of Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf.

qa_pairs.question: Can benefits be paid for a Total Disability due to a Pre-Existing Condition? If yes, under what conditions?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, benefits may be payable for a Total Disability due to a Pre-Existing Condition if the Employee was insured by the prior carrier's policy at the time of transfer and was Actively-At-Work and insured under the Policy on the Policy's Effective Date. This is detailed on page 26 and 27 of Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf. If the Insured Employee qualifies for benefits, the Company will apply the Policy's Pre-Existing Condition Exclusion, but can satisfy the prior carrier's condition giving consideration towards continuous time insured under both policies; then he/she will be paid according to the Policy's benefit schedule mentioned on page 32 of Lincoln Cert 5439095 conditions and requirements of the Policy. This is stated on page 32 Existing Condition Exclusion, as detailed on page 3 carrier's policy, whichever results in a greater benefit amount. qa_pairs.question: What is the elimination period for Disability caused by the same or a related Sickness or Injury?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page 5, the Elimination Period is 90 calendar days of Disability which must be accumulated within a 180 calendar day period.

qa_pairs.question: What is the maximum benefit period for an Insured Employee due to Sickness, Injury or Pre-Existing Conditions?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page 9, the Maximum Benefit Period for an Insured Employee depends on their age at Disability. For ages less than 60 to 69 and Over, it is 12 months, 60 months, 48 months, 42 months, 36 months, 30 months, 24 months, 21 months, 18 months, 15 months, respectively. For age 65, it is 24 months and for age 66, it is 21 months. For ages 67 and over, it is 12 months.

Monthly Earnings.content: It will not exceed the amount shown in the Employer's financial records, the amount for which premium has been paid, or the Maximum Covered Monthly Earnings permitted by the Policy; whichever is less. For an Insured Employee who did not receive a W-2 form from the Employer prior to the Determination Date, it is figured by averaging the monthly gross earnings received during the actual period of employment, as shown in the Employer's financial records.

qa_pairs.question: What is the Maximum Benefit Period for Sickness, Injury or Pre-Existing Conditions based on the Insured Employee's age at disability?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page [3, 18, 19, 20, 23, 24, 25, 28, 31, 40], the Maximum Benefit Period for Insured Employees with a disability at age less than 60 is 60 months. For ages 61 to 65, it ranges from 48 to 21 months, and for ages 66 and above, it's 12 months.

qa_pairs.question: How does the Maximum Benefit Period apply during a Recurrent Disability?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page [3, 18, 19, 20, 23, 24, 25, 28, 31, 40], the Maximum Benefit Period shown in the Schedule of Insurance applies during a Recurrent Disability, but if the Policy includes a provision for reinstatement, the same Maximum Benefit Period as the prior Disability will apply.

qa_pairs.question: What are the circumstances under which the Monthly Benefit payments would cease?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page [3, 18, 19, 20, 23, 24, 25, 28, 31, 40], the Monthly Benefit payments would cease either when the Maximum Benefit Period shown in the Schedule of Insurance ends or when the Insured Employee dies. If the Policy includes a Family Income Benefit, the amount paid to the Eligible Surviving Spouse or Children will not increase due to the Insured Employee's receipt of this Progressive Income Benefit, but the Monthly Benefit will still be paid in no event beyond the Maximum Benefit Period shown in the Schedule of Insurance.

qa_pairs.question: What are the circumstances under which the Monthly Benefit payments would cease?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page [3, 18, 19, 20, 23, 24, 25, 28, 31, 40], the Monthly Benefit payments would cease either when the Maximum Benefit Period shown in the Schedule of Insurance ends or when the Insured Employee dies. If the Policy includes a Family Income Benefit, the amount paid to the Eligible Surviving Spouse or Children will not increase due to the Insured Employee's receipt of this Progressive Income Benefit, but the Monthly Benefit will still be paid in no event beyond the Maximum Benefit Period shown in the Schedule of Insurance.

Maximum Benefit.selected_text: Elimination Period, Maximum Benefit Period, Own Occupation Period and Waiting Period. If your Booklet, Certificate
Maximum Benefit.content: All employees are given a Certificate of Group Insurance which contains a detailed description of the Benefits, Pre- Existing Condition Limitation, Exclusions and Prior Carrier Credit provisions. The Certificate also contains the Schedule of Benefits which includes information on the Benefit Percentage, Maximum and Minimum Monthly Benefits, Elimination Period, Maximum Benefit Period, Own Occupation Period and Waiting Period. If your Booklet, Certificate or Schedule of Benefits has been misplaced, you may obtain a copy from the Plan Administrator at no charge. Eligibility. Full-time employees working at least 30 hours per week. Employees become eligible on the first of the month coinciding with or next following active full-time employment. Contributions. Insured employees are not required to contribute to the cost of the Long-Term Disability coverage. The Plan's year ends on: December 31 st  of each year. The name and section of relevant Collective Bargaining Agreements: None The name, title and address of each Plan Trustee: None

qa_pairs.question: What is the definition of Own Occupation Period during the Elimination Period?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page [3, 7, 8, 9], during the Elimination Period, Own Occupation Period means a period beginning at the end of the Elimination Period and ending at the end of the Maximum Benefit Period for Insured Employees. During this period, it means that due to an Injury or Sickness the Insured Employee is unable to perform each of the Main Duties of his or her Own Occupation.

qa_pairs.question: What happens after the Own Occupation Period regarding the inability to perform duties?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page [3, 7, 8, 9], after the Own Occupation Period, it means that due to an Injury or Sickness the Insured Employee is unable to perform each of the Main Duties of any occupation which his or her training, education or experience will reasonably allow.

qa_pairs.question: What event does not by itself constitute Total Disability according to the provided document?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page [3, 7, 8, 9], the loss of a professional license, an occupational license or certification, or a driver's license for any reason does not, by itself, constitute Total Disability.

qa_pairs.question: What does the Voluntary Vocational Rehabilitation Benefit consist of, according to Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page 28?
qa_pairs.answer: The Voluntary Vocational Rehabilitation Benefit consists of services such as vocational evaluation, counseling, training or job placement; job modification or special equipment; and other services deemed reasonably necessary to help the Insured Employee return to work.

qa_pairs.answer: The amount of any Vocational Rehabilitation Benefit will not exceed the Company's expected claims liability.

qa_pairs.answer: The Policy will not cover any period of Disability for an Insured Employee who has received a Vocational Rehabilitation Benefit and has failed to complete the Program, without Good Cause.

qa_pairs.question: On what terms will the coverage be provided for an employee who meets the conditions for Prior Insurance Credit, according to page 40 of Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf?
qa_pairs.answer: Based on Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page 40, the coverage for an employee meeting the conditions for Prior Insurance Credit will be that provided by the prior carrier's policy, had it remained in force. Carrier.selected_text: insurance consultant, selection of the insurance carrier and assisting The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company. The
Carrier.content: The Plan Administrator is responsible for the administration of the Plan and is the designated agent for the service of legal process for the Plan. Functions performed by the Plan Administrator include: the receipt and deposit of contributions, maintenance of records of Plan participants, authorization and payment of Plan administrative expenses, selection of the insurance consultant, selection of the insurance carrier and assisting The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company. The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company has the sole discretionary authority to determine eligibility and to administer claims in accord with its interpretation of policy provisions, on the Plan Administrator's behalf (this does not apply to employers sitused in California or to California residents). Type of Administration. The Plan is administered directly by the Plan Administrator with benefits provided in accordance with provisions of the group insurance policy issued by The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company whose Group Insurance Service Office address is 8801 Indian Hills Drive, Omaha, Nebraska. Type of Plan. The benefits provided under the Plan are: Group Long Term Disability Insurance benefits. Type of Funding Arrangement: The Lincoln National Life Insurance Company. All employees are given a Certificate of Group Insurance which contains a detailed description of the Benefits, Pre- Existing Condition Limitation, Exclusions and Prior Carrier Credit provisions. The Certificate also contains the Schedule of Benefits which includes information on the Benefit Percentage, Maximum and Minimum Monthly Benefits, Elimination Period, Maximum Benefit Period, Own Occupation Period and Waiting Period. If your Booklet, Certificate or Schedule of Benefits has been misplaced, you may obtain a copy from the Plan Administrator at no charge. Eligibility. Full-time employees working at least 30 hours per week. Employees become eligible on the first of the month coinciding with or next following active full-time employment. Contributions. Insured employees are not required to contribute to the cost of the Long-Term Disability coverage. The Plan's year ends on: December 31 st  of each year. The name and section of relevant Collective Bargaining Agreements: None The name, title and address of each Plan Trustee: None

State.content: A  "Material Misrepresentation"  is an incomplete or untrue statement that caused the Company to issue coverage that it would have disapproved, had it known the truth.  "To rescind"  means to cancel insurance back to its effective date. State.selected_text: Benefits for the former Employee will be reinstated for the Recurrent Disability and the
State.content: Benefits for the former Employee will be reinstated for the Recurrent Disability and the completion of a new Elimination Period will not be required before further Monthly Benefits become payable. The same Maximum Benefit Period, Exclusions, and Limitations will apply to the Recurrent Disability as to the prior Disability. The Predisability Income used in determining the prior Disability benefit will apply as well. Benefits reinstated under this provision are subject to the Policy's terms and conditions that were in effect at the time the prior Disability began. To qualify for a Monthly Benefit, the Insured Employee or former Employee must earn less than the percentage of Predisability Income specified in the Partial Disability Monthly Benefit section. Monthly Benefit payments will be subject to all other terms of the Policy that applied to the prior Disability. This Recurrent Disability provision will cease to apply to an Insured Employee or former Employee who becomes eligible for coverage under any other group long-term disability plan.

State.selected_text: Residents of this state who purchase life insurance, annuities or health and accident insurance should know that
State.content: Residents of this state who purchase life insurance, annuities or health and accident insurance should know that the insurance companies licensed in this state to write these types of insurance are members of the Arkansas Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association ("Guaranty Association"). The purpose of the Guaranty Association is to assure that policy and contract owners will be protected, within certain limits, in the unlikely event that a member insurer becomes financially unable to meet its obligations. If this should happen, the Guaranty Association will assess its other member insurance companies for the money to pay the claims of policy owners who live in this state and, in some cases, to keep coverage in force. The valuable extra protection provided by the member insurers through the Guaranty Association is not unlimited, however. And, as noted in the box below, this protection is not a substitute for consumers' care in selecting insurance companies that are well managed and financially stable.

State.content: This written request for review should state the reasons why you feel the claim should not have been denied and should include any additional documentation to support your claim. If more information is needed to resolve a claim, the information must be supplied within 45 days after requested. Any resulting delay will not count toward the above time limits for claims or appeals processing. Please refer to your certificate of insurance for more information about how to file a claim, how to appeal a denied claim, and for details regarding the claims procedures.

State.selected_text: denied or ignored, in whole or in part, you may file suit in a state or Federal court. If it should happen that plan fiduciaries misuse the
State.content: Under ERISA, there are steps you can take to enforce the above rights. For instance, if you request a copy of plan documents or the latest annual report from the plan and do not receive them within 30 days, you may file suit in a Federal court. In such a case, the court may require the Plan Administrator to provide the materials and pay you up to $110 a day until you receive the materials, unless the materials were not sent because of reasons beyond the control of the Administrator. If you have a claim for benefits which is denied or ignored, in whole or in part, you may file suit in a state or Federal court. If it should happen that plan fiduciaries misuse the plan's money, or if you are discriminated against for asserting your rights, you may seek assistance from the U.S. Department of Labor, or you may file suit in a Federal court. The court will decide who should pay court costs and legal fees. If you are successful the court may order the person you have sued to pay these costs and fees. If you lose, the court may order you to pay these costs and fees, for example, if it finds your claim is frivolous.

State.content: We may share your personal information within our companies and with certain service providers. They use this information to process transactions you, your employer, or your group representative have requested; to provide customer service; to analyze in order to evaluate or enhance our products and services; to gain customer insight; to provide education and training to our workforce and customers; and to inform you of products or services we offer that you may find useful. Our service providers may or may not be affiliated with us. They include financial service providers (for example, third party administrators; broker-dealers; insurance agents and brokers, registered representatives; reinsurers and other financial services companies with whom we have joint marketing agreements). Our service providers also include non-financial companies and individuals (for example, consultants; vendors; and companies that perform marketing services on our behalf). Information we obtain from a report prepared by a service provider may be kept by the service provider and shared with other persons; however, we require our service providers to protect your personal information and to use or disclose it only for the work they are performing for us, or as permitted by law. We may execute agreements with our service providers that permit the service provider to process your personal information outside of the United States, when not prohibited by our contracts and permitted by applicable law. When you apply for one of our products, we may share information about your application with credit bureaus. We also may provide information to group policy owners or their designees (for example, to your employer for employer-sponsored plans and their authorized service providers), regulatory authorities and law enforcement officials, and to other non-affiliated or affiliated parties as permitted by law. In the event of a sale of all or part of our businesses, we may share customer information as part of the sale.  We do not sell or release your information to outside marketers who may want to offer you their own products

If you would like to act upon your rights regarding your personal information, please provide your full name, address and telephone number and either email your inquiry to our Data Subject Access Request Team at DSAR@lfg.com or mail to: Lincoln Financial Group, Attn: Corporate Privacy Office, 1301 South Harrison St., Fort Wayne, IN 46802. The DSAR@lfg.com email address should only be used for inquiries related to this Privacy Notice. For general account service requests or inquiries, please call 1-

Survivor Benefit.selected_text: Any Survivor Benefit will be payable in accord with that section.
Survivor Benefit.content: 1. Any Survivor Benefit will be payable in accord with that section. 2. Any other benefits will be payable to the Insured Employee's estate.

qa_pairs.question: What type of benefit will be payable according to the Survivor Benefit section?
qa_pairs.answer: Any Survivor Benefit will be payable in accord with that section (Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page [12]).

qa_pairs.question: To whom will other benefits be payable if the Insured Employee passes away?
qa_pairs.answer: Other benefits will be payable to the Insured Employee's estate (Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf page [12]).

qa_pairs.question: What is the duration of the Three Month Survivor Benefit as mentioned in the document?
qa_pairs.answer: The duration for the Three Month Survivor Benefit isn't explicitly stated on pages [12, 33] of Lincoln Cert 5439095.pdf. However, more information regarding this benefit may be found elsewhere in the document.
